programme.title: The United States Vs. Billie Holiday
programme.desc: The acclaimed singer is targeted by the Federal Department of Narcotics with an undercover sting operation led by Federal Agent Jimmy Fletcher, with who she had a tumultuous affair. Director Lee Daniels' biopic based on the novel by Johann Hari, starring Andra Day, Trevante Rhodes and Natasha Lyonne.

programme.title: Scent of a Woman
programme.desc: A blind, hard-drinking war veteran pays a timid college student to accompany him on a weekend break in the big city, where he plans to make the most of life. However, the youngster is shocked to learn that at the end of their trip, his new friend plans to kill himself. Comedy drama, starring an Oscar-winning Al Pacino, Chris O'Donnell, Gabrielle Anwar and Philip Seymour Hoffman.

programme.title: Dunkirk
programme.desc: Allied soldiers from Belgium, the British Empire and France are surrounded by the German army, and face a tense wait for evacuation, during a fierce battle in northern France during the Second World War. Christopher Nolan's wartime drama, which he wrote, directed and produced, starring Kenneth Branagh, Tom Hardy, Mark Rylance and Fionn Whitehead.

programme.title: Lost in Translation
programme.desc: A lonely and past-his-prime American actor travels to Japan to film a commercial. During a depressing night in the hotel bar, he meets a spirited younger woman and the pair strike up a close friendship, exploring Tokyo and helping each other face the mundanities of everyday life. Sofia Coppola's comedy drama, starring Bill Murray, Scarlett Johansson and Giovanni Ribisi.

programme.title: Sundown
programme.desc: Neil and Alice Bennett are the core of a wealthy family on holiday in Mexico, until a distant emergency cuts their trip short. When one relative disrupts the family's tight-knit order, simmering tensions rise to the fore. Drama, starring Tim Roth, Albertine Kotting McMillan and Samuel Bottomley.

programme.title: Fanny and Alexander
programme.desc: Ingmar Bergman's Oscar-winning semi-autobiographical drama follows the lives of two children from a theatrical family in turn of the century Sweden. Their carefree lives are thrown into upheaval by the death of their father and their mother's subsequent remarriage to a puritanical minister. But refuge from their joyless new home comes in the shape of their grandmother and her lover. Starring Pernilla Allwin, Bertil Guve, Gunn Wallgren and Lena Olin.

programme.title: Footloose
programme.desc: A teenager from Boston moves to a small conservative town, and discovers the council and a preacher have enforced a ban on loud music and dancing. He openly defies the harsh rules, revitalising the local youth and winning the heart of the reverend's daughter. Remake of the 1984 drama, with Kenny Wormald, Julianne Hough and Dennis Quaid.

programme.title: Speak Like a Child
programme.desc: A couple are reunited with a man they grew up with in a children's home years earlier - but the apparently happy reunion soon dredges up dark secrets from their past, and it's not long before tensions bubble to the surface. Drama, starring Cal Macaninch, Daniel Newman, Richard Mylan and Rachel Fielding.

programme.title: Footloose
programme.desc: A teenager from Boston moves to a small conservative town, and discovers the council and a preacher have enforced a ban on loud music and dancing. He openly defies the harsh rules, revitalising the local youth and winning the heart of the reverend's daughter. Remake of the 1984 drama, with Kenny Wormald, Julianne Hough and Dennis Quaid.

programme.title: To Olivia
programme.desc: In 1962, writer Roald Dahl and his movie star wife Patricia Neal have retreated to the English countryside to bring up their young family. Tragically, their lives are turned upside down by the death of their daughter, Olivia. As the couple struggle through the loss, their grief becomes a source of redemption and strength which changes their destiny. Drama, starring Hugh Bonneville, Keeley Hawes and in one of his final films, Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Hawaii
programme.desc: A 19th-century missionary and his wife try to bring Christianity to the natives of the Hawaiian islands, little realising that their incursion will forever change the attitude of the indigenous population. It's not long before the couple's differing viewpoints drive a wedge between them - leading to betrayal. Historical drama, starring Max von Sydow, Julie Andrews and Richard Harris.

programme.title: What Dreams May Come
programme.desc: The spirit of a man killed in a car crash uses his vivid imagination to create a breath-taking world - but he is unable to fully enjoy his heavenly home without his wife beside him. However, when grief drives her to suicide, she ends up in an altogether more hellish afterlife, prompting her husband to embark on a perilous mission to rescue her from the dark side. Fantasy, starring Robin Williams, Cuba Gooding Jr, Annabella Sciorra and Max von Sydow.

programme.title: Speak Like a Child
programme.desc: A couple are reunited with a man they grew up with in a children's home years earlier - but the apparently happy reunion soon dredges up dark secrets from their past, and it's not long before tensions bubble to the surface. Drama, starring Cal Macaninch, Daniel Newman, Richard Mylan and Rachel Fielding.

programme.title: My First Summer
programme.desc: Isolated on a remote property after her mother's death, 16-year-old Claudia finds her world transformed when spirited teenager Grace appears. Drama, starring Markella Kavenagh and Maiah Stewardson.(n)

programme.title: Echoes of a Summer
programme.desc: An 11-year-old girl dying of heart disease, spends her last summer holidaying with her parents in Nova Scotia. Sentimental drama, starring Jodie Foster, Richard Harris, Lois Nettleton and Geraldine Fitzgerald.(n)

programme.title: Hawaii
programme.desc: A 19th-century missionary and his wife try to bring Christianity to the natives of the Hawaiian islands, little realising that their incursion will forever change the attitude of the indigenous population. It's not long before the couple's differing viewpoints drive a wedge between them - leading to betrayal. Historical drama, starring Max von Sydow, Julie Andrews and Richard Harris.(n)

programme.title: What Dreams May Come
programme.desc: The spirit of a man killed in a car crash uses his vivid imagination to create a breath-taking world - but he is unable to fully enjoy his heavenly home without his wife beside him. However, when grief drives her to suicide, she ends up in an altogether more hellish afterlife, prompting her husband to embark on a perilous mission to rescue her from the dark side. Fantasy, starring Robin Williams, Cuba Gooding Jr, Annabella Sciorra and Max von Sydow.(n)

programme.title: Speak Like a Child
programme.desc: A couple are reunited with a man they grew up with in a children's home years earlier - but the apparently happy reunion soon dredges up dark secrets from their past, and it's not long before tensions bubble to the surface. Drama, starring Cal Macaninch, Daniel Newman, Richard Mylan and Rachel Fielding.(n)

programme.title: To Olivia
programme.desc: In 1962, writer Roald Dahl and his movie star wife Patricia Neal have retreated to the English countryside to bring up their young family. Tragically, their lives are turned upside down by the death of their daughter, Olivia. As the couple struggle through the loss, their grief becomes a source of redemption and strength which changes their destiny. Drama, starring Hugh Bonneville, Keeley Hawes and in one of his final films, Geoffrey Palmer.(n)

programme.title: Miss Potter
programme.desc: Victorian writer and illustrator Beatrix Potter is unable to find a firm willing to give her book based on a character called Peter Rabbit a chance, until a timid publisher with whom she falls in love takes on her project. Biographical period drama, starring Renee Zellweger, Ewan McGregor, Emily Watson and Barbara Flynn.(n)

programme.title: 8 Mile
programme.desc: A white rapper strives to make a name for himself on the music scene, but his deprived home life on a Detroit trailer park and romantic complications put a damper on his plans as he struggles to win over the crowds and earn the respect of his peers. Drama, starring Eminem, Kim Basinger, Mekhi Phifer and Brittany Murphy.(n)

programme.title: My First Summer
programme.desc: Isolated on a remote property after her mother's death, 16-year-old Claudia finds her world transformed when spirited teenager Grace appears. Drama, starring Markella Kavenagh and Maiah Stewardson.(n)

programme.title: Echoes of a Summer
programme.desc: An 11-year-old girl dying of heart disease, spends her last summer holidaying with her parents in Nova Scotia. Sentimental drama, starring Jodie Foster, Richard Harris, Lois Nettleton and Geraldine Fitzgerald.(n)

programme.title: Do the Right Thing
programme.desc: Racial tensions erupt in a Brooklyn neighbourhood on the hottest day of the summer. The simmering conflicts centre on the Italian-owned local pizza parlour, as a minor dispute gradually escalates into full-blown violence. Drama, directed by and starring Spike Lee, with Danny Aiello, John Turturro, Ossie Davis, Rosie Perez and Samuel L Jackson.(n)

programme.title: Drift
programme.desc: A young woman escapes her war-torn country to a Greek island, growing close with a tour guide as the pair find hope in each other. Director Anthony Chen's drama, starring Cynthia Erivo and Alia Shawkat.(n)

programme.title: Noah's Ark
programme.desc: Tom and Vini are mice who stow away on Noah's ark. They must use their musical talents to enter a competition and help maintain peace among the animals. Animated adventure, featuring the voices of Rodrigo Santoro and Marcelo Adnet.(n)

programme.title: Sneaks
programme.desc: Ty is a designer trainer who lives a life of luxury and comfort. However, when a shady shoe collector steals his sister, Ty, is forced to venture out into the world, and onto the streets of New York, to rescue her. Animated comedy, with the voices of Anthony Mackie, Keith David and Laurence Fishburne.(n)

programme.title: The Good Half
programme.desc: Returning home for his mother's funeral, Renn Wheeland forges new relationships and heals old ones as he faces his grief. Drama, starring Nick Jonas, David Arquette and Brittany Snow.(n)

programme.title: Babes
programme.desc: After New York yoga teacher Dawn goes into labour, best friend Eden offers wise-cracking support to herald the safe arrival of a baby girl. Later, Eden falls pregnant after meeting an actor, who subsequently ghosts her. Comedy, co-written by and starring Ilana Glazer, with Michelle Buteau and John Carroll Lynch.(n)

programme.title: Afraid
programme.desc: Computer engineering company executive Curtis is coerced into testing a new digital assistant named AIA to secure a lucrative business contract with two tech geniuses. Writer/director Chris Weitz's sci-fi horror, starring John Cho, Katherine Waterston and Keith Carradine.(n)

Upon returning to Boston, Lily is attracted to Ryle Kincaid, a neurosurgeon with a dark side, and old flame Atlas Corrigan. Drama based on the bestselling novel, starring Blake Lively, Justin Baldoni, Jenny Slate and Brandon Sklenar.(n)

programme.title: I'll Be Right There
programme.desc: A woman navigates the challenges of her pregnant daughter's wedding plans, her mother's health concerns and her own romantic dilemmas. Director Brendan Walsh's comedy, starring Edie Falco and Jeannie Berlin.(n)

programme.desc: A travelling salesman drowning under the weight of providing for his family finds himself on a dangerous path after a chance encounter with a colleague. Action thriller, starring Scoot McNairy, Kit Harington, Josh Lucas and Ethan Suplee.(n)

programme.title: Skincare
programme.desc: Small business owner Hope Goldman performs facials to celebrity clientele and powerful businesswomen. She is poised to launch her own skincare line, but is in arrears with rent on her store at a shopping complex. A rival called Angel opens in close proximity and soon after, her email is hacked and tyres slashed. Hope is convinced that Angel is the culprit and enlists hired thug Armen and young beau Jordan to extinguish the competition. Director Austin Peters' thriller, starring Elizabeth Banks and Lewis Pullman.(n)

programme.desc: Hard news and analysis of compelling stories from DC and across the country; journalists provide viewers with must-see information and consequential news.

programme.title: The Five
programme.desc: Dana Perino, Greg Gutfeld, Jesse Watters, Jeanine Pirro and a rotating host discuss and debate hot issues across the spectrum, from politics to pop culture; the hosts also conclude each show with the "One More Thing" segment.

programme.title: Jesse Watters Primetime
programme.desc: Jesse Watters speaks with newsmakers from across America to present news with a clear and direct approach.

programme.title: The Day Of The Jackal
programme.desc: When meticulous hitman Edward Fox is hired to kill the French president, detective Michael Lonsdale faces a race against time to track him down. Violent scenes.

programme.title: Mr. Holmes
programme.desc: Ian McKellen's 93-year-old Sherlock battles his fading memory as he pieces together the details of his final case. With Laura Linney and Milo Parker.

programme.title: The Danish Girl
programme.desc: Tom Hooper's true-life drama tells the remarkable tale of transgender pioneer Lili Elbe. Eddie Redmayne stars alongside Oscar winner Alicia Vikander.

programme.title: Boy In The Striped Pyjamas
programme.desc: The son of a Nazi officer befriends a young concentration camp inmate, learning the terrible truth about his father's work. Poignant drama. Mature themes.

programme.title: Forrest Gump
programme.desc: Robert Zemeckis' whimsical, sextuple Oscar-winning fable stars Tom Hanks as an extraordinary man who leads a charmed existence over four turbulent decades of US history.

programme.title: The Girl On The Train
programme.desc: Adaptation of the hit book starring Emily Blunt as an alcoholic divorcee caught up in a missing person case that sends shockwaves throughout her life.

programme.title: It Ends With Us
programme.desc: Lily's abusive relationship is shaken after her first love reappears. Drama based on the bestselling novel, starring Blake Lively.

programme.title: The Da Vinci Code
programme.desc: Tom Hanks and Audrey Tautou race across Europe in a bid to uncover a secret. Mystery thriller based on the Dan Brown novel. Violence/sex.

programme.title: Crazy Rich Asians
programme.desc: When an NYU professor heads to Singapore with her boyfriend, she's surprised to learn he's from an extremely wealthy family... who aren't so approving of her. Hit romcom.

programme.title: Fear And Loathing In Las Vegas
programme.desc: Writer Johnny Depp and lawyer Benicio Del Toro drive to Las Vegas, fuelled by a cocktail of psychedelic drugs. Road movie based on Hunter S Thompson's novel. Mature themes.

programme.title: Hellraiser
programme.desc: A cheating wife accidentally summons the Cenobites - a group of supernatural beings - while going to great lengths to resurrect her brother-in-law. Iconic 80s horror movie.

programme.title: Lawless
programme.desc: Gritty crime drama about bootlegging brothers who fall foul of a ruthless lawman in prohibition-era Virginia. Tom Hardy and Shia LaBeouf star.

programme.title: Desperation Road
programme.desc: A mother and her child are caught in the crossfire as alcohol, guns and revenge clash. Thriller with Mel Gibson. Contains scenes of sexual violence.

programme.title: Sky Cinema Preview
programme.desc: Previews of the great films now playing on Sky Cinema plus other highlights showing on Sky.

programme.title: Carmen
programme.desc: With an original score, Benjamin Millepied's reimagining of Prosper MÃ©rimÃ©e's 1845 novella is a dramatic modern day tale told through dance and an experimental dreamscape.

programme.title: The Hanging Sun
programme.desc: A hitman seeks refuge in a small village where he is faced with events that test his conscience. Sky Original film with Jessica Brown Findlay and Alessandro Borghi.

programme.title: Eileen
programme.desc: Eileen's job at the local prison takes a twisted turn when new counsellor Anne Hathaway arrives, leading her down a sinister path. Mystery thriller.

programme.title: Dear John
programme.desc: Amanda Seyfried and Channing Tatum star as a couple struggling to keep their romance alive when he goes to war after 9/11. Moving romance. Contains flashing images.

programme.title: Crazy Rich Asians
programme.desc: When an NYU professor heads to Singapore with her boyfriend, she's surprised to learn he's from an extremely wealthy family... who aren't so approving of her. Hit romcom.

programme.title: The Color Purple
programme.desc: A woman faces many hardships in her life, but ultimately finds extraordinary strength and hope in the unbreakable bonds of sisterhood. Drama.

programme.title: Angels & Demons
programme.desc: Tom Hanks is called in to save Vatican City from being incinerated by an ancient sect. Sequel to The Da Vinci Code. Contains violence.

programme.title: Field Of Dreams
programme.desc: Moving fantasy starring Kevin Costner as a Iowa farmer who, in answer to a mystical voice, turns his cornfield into a baseball pitch, with miraculous results.

programme.title: Lawless
programme.desc: Gritty crime drama about bootlegging brothers who fall foul of a ruthless lawman in prohibition-era Virginia. Tom Hardy and Shia LaBeouf star.

programme.title: Minority Report
programme.desc: Future cop Tom Cruise goes on the run for a murder he's yet to commit in Spielberg's dazzling sci-fi thriller. With Colin Farrell. Strong language/violence/flashing images.

programme.title: The Hanging Sun
programme.desc: A hitman seeks refuge in a small village where he is faced with events that test his conscience. Sky Original film with Jessica Brown Findlay and Alessandro Borghi.

programme.title: Eileen
programme.desc: Eileen's job at the local prison takes a twisted turn when new counsellor Anne Hathaway arrives, leading her down a sinister path. Mystery thriller.

programme.title: Dear John
programme.desc: Amanda Seyfried and Channing Tatum star as a couple struggling to keep their romance alive when he goes to war after 9/11. Moving romance. Contains flashing images.

programme.title: Crazy Rich Asians
programme.desc: When an NYU professor heads to Singapore with her boyfriend, she's surprised to learn he's from an extremely wealthy family... who aren't so approving of her. Hit romcom.

programme.title: The Color Purple
programme.desc: A woman faces many hardships in her life, but ultimately finds extraordinary strength and hope in the unbreakable bonds of sisterhood. Drama.

programme.title: Angels & Demons
programme.desc: Tom Hanks is called in to save Vatican City from being incinerated by an ancient sect. Sequel to The Da Vinci Code. Contains violence.

programme.title: Field Of Dreams
programme.desc: Moving fantasy starring Kevin Costner as a Iowa farmer who, in answer to a mystical voice, turns his cornfield into a baseball pitch, with miraculous results.

programme.title: Lawless
programme.desc: Gritty crime drama about bootlegging brothers who fall foul of a ruthless lawman in prohibition-era Virginia. Tom Hardy and Shia LaBeouf star.

programme.title: Minority Report
programme.desc: Future cop Tom Cruise goes on the run for a murder he's yet to commit in Spielberg's dazzling sci-fi thriller. With Colin Farrell. Strong language/violence/flashing images.

programme.title: Naked Lunch
programme.desc: Peter Weller stars as an ex-drug addict who makes a living from killing cockroaches - until he is sucked into a surreal world. Disturbing drama.

programme.title: The Saint
programme.desc: Val Kilmer is ace thief and master of disguise Simon Templar, hired to steal an energy formula from inventor Elisabeth Shue. Action adventure. Strong language/violence.

programme.title: Battle Royale
programme.desc: It's kill or be killed as a group of school kids are sent to an island and forced to take each other out until just one remains. Dystopian action.

programme.title: Charlie's Angels
programme.desc: Action comedy adventure based on the 1970s TV series, starring Cameron Diaz, Drew Barrymore and Lucy Liu, and featuring Bill Murray. When a top computer boffin is kidnapped, crime-busting trio Natalie, Dylan and Alex become involved in a game of betrayal and deception.

programme.title: Charlie's Angels: Full Throttle
programme.desc: Action comedy adventure sequel based on the popular 1970s TV series, starring Cameron Diaz, Drew Barrymore and Lucy Liu. When the special agents investigate a series of deaths connected to the Federal Witness Protection Programme, they discover evidence that points to "fallen" Angel Madison Lee.

programme.title: The Bricklayer
programme.desc: Former CIA agent Steve Vail is reactivated when an extortionist targets the agency. Director Renny Harlin's thriller based on the Noah Boyd novel, starring Aaron Eckhart, Nina Dobrev and Clifton Collins Jr.

programme.title: The Great Escaper
programme.desc: Former Royal Navy officer Bernie Jordan is happily settled with wife Rene at a care home. Unfortunately, he hasn't secured a place on the official British Royal Legion trip to France to the commemorate the 70th anniversary of the D-Day landings. Bernie needs to make the trip to Normandy for personal reasons, and with Rene's blessing, he sneaks off to pay his respects. Drama, starring Michael Caine

programme.title: There's Something in the Barn
programme.desc: Festive horror comedy starring Martin Starr and Amrita Acharia. After inheriting a house in the mountains of Norway, an American family ups sticks from California and relocates. However, their decision to convert the property's old barn into an Airbnb unwittingly disturbs the creature that lives there - and hell hath no fury like an angry barn elf.

programme.title: The Cinema List: Biopic
programme.desc: When life inspires film, the most incredible stories are told. Join us as we journey through some of our favourite biopics, from Sky Original film Lee to Goodfellas and Back to Black.

programme.title: The American Society of Magical Negroes
programme.desc: Satirical fantasy comedy starring Justice Smith and David Alan Grier. Genial artist Aren, who is African-American, is struggling to make sense of his place in the world until he's invited to join a secret society dedicated to enhancing the lives of white people. However, Aren's debut mission tests his loyalty when he and his first assignment fall for the same person.

programme.title: Jericho Ridge
programme.desc: Action thriller starring Nikki Amuka-Bird. Injured police deputy Tabby Temple returns to work after a period of leave to discover that the station has been broken into and weaponry stolen. Her colleagues leave her to work dispatch for the night, but with a pair of local criminals still sniffing around the station, Tabby soon finds herself at the centre of a siege that steadily escalates.

programme.title: The Bricklayer
programme.desc: Former CIA agent Steve Vail is reactivated when an extortionist targets the agency. Director Renny Harlin's thriller based on the Noah Boyd novel, starring Aaron Eckhart, Nina Dobrev and Clifton Collins Jr.

programme.title: Charlie's Angels
programme.desc: Action comedy adventure based on the 1970s TV series, starring Cameron Diaz, Drew Barrymore and Lucy Liu, and featuring Bill Murray. When a top computer boffin is kidnapped, crime-busting trio Natalie, Dylan and Alex become involved in a game of betrayal and deception.

programme.title: Charlie's Angels: Full Throttle
programme.desc: Action comedy adventure sequel based on the popular 1970s TV series, starring Cameron Diaz, Drew Barrymore and Lucy Liu. When the special agents investigate a series of deaths connected to the Federal Witness Protection Programme, they discover evidence that points to "fallen" Angel Madison Lee.

programme.title: A Star Is Born
programme.desc: Musical romantic drama starring Lady Gaga and Bradley Cooper. Rock star Jackson Maine meets aspiring songwriter Ally, a waitress who moonlights as a bar singer. Mesmerised by Ally's talent, Jackson invites her to perform with him and she becomes a sensation. The two begin a romantic relationship, but their happiness is threatened as an increasingly washed-up Jackson grapples with substance abuse i

programme.title: Madame Web
programme.desc: Superhero action adventure starring Dakota Johnson. While on a dangerous job, New York paramedic Cassie Webb has a near-fatal accident and develops precognitive powers. When she foresees that three young women are in danger, she sets out to protect them from the super-powered villain who wants them dead.

programme.title: A Quiet Place
programme.desc: Horror thriller starring Emily Blunt and John Krasinski. After blind insectoid monsters with super-sensitive hearing wipe out most of humanity, a family of survivors adapts to living in silence. But with a new baby on the way, their noiseless way of life is about to become a lot more difficult...

programme.title: A Quiet Place: Day One
programme.desc: Sci-fi horror prequel starring Lupita Nyong'o and Joseph Quinn. New York City is suddenly attacked by terrifying alien creatures with super-sensitive hearing. Sam, a terminally ill cancer patient, and law student Eric are among those who have survived the initial assault - but how long can they remain alive when the faintest noise can be deadly?

programme.title: Jericho Ridge
programme.desc: Action thriller starring Nikki Amuka-Bird. Injured police deputy Tabby Temple returns to work after a period of leave to discover that the station has been broken into and weaponry stolen. Her colleagues leave her to work dispatch for the night, but with a pair of local criminals still sniffing around the station, Tabby soon finds herself at the centre of a siege that steadily escalates.

programme.desc: In the Stone Age, a gang of early humans face a mystical being hellbent on hunting them down. Prehistoric horror, starring Iola Evans and Arno LÃ¼ning. The dialogue is in a specially contructed language and features subtitles.

programme.title: Sky Cinema Preview-April 2025
programme.desc: Previews of the films now playing on Sky Cinema, plus other highlights showing on Sky.

programme.title: Night Swim
programme.desc: Forced into early retirement by a degenerative illness, former baseball player Ray Waller moves into a new house with his wife and two children. He hopes that the backyard swimming pool will be fun for the kids and provide physical therapy for himself. However, a dark secret from the home's past soon unleashes a malevolent force that drags the family into the depths of inescapable terror. Writer/d

programme.title: Arthur's Whisky
programme.desc: When Joan's husband dies, she discovers he'd invented an anti-aging elixir that literally takes the years off. Sharing it with her friends Linda and Susan, the rejuvenated women waste little time in painting the town red, but they soon realise it's a very different world to the one they remember. Co-writer/director Stephen Cookson's comedy, starring Diane Keaton, Hayley Mills, Patricia Hodge, Lulu

programme.title: There's Something in the Barn
programme.desc: Festive horror comedy starring Martin Starr and Amrita Acharia. After inheriting a house in the mountains of Norway, an American family ups sticks from California and relocates. However, their decision to convert the property's old barn into an Airbnb unwittingly disturbs the creature that lives there - and hell hath no fury like an angry barn elf.

programme.title: Robin and the Hoods
programme.desc: Fantasy adventure starring Darcey Ewart and Naomie Harris. Robin is an 11-year-old girl who plays imaginative games with her friends, the Hoods, on the wooded land near to their homes. They engage in pretend battles against rival gangs, but a greater challenge emerges when a property developer, "Clipboard", threatens to transform their kingdom into a leisure facility.

programme.title: Mean Girls
programme.desc: High school outcasts Janis Sarkisian and Damian Hubbard narrate the tale of 15-year-old Cady Heron, who moves back to America from Kenya with her mother. Janis encourages Cady to infiltrate the Plastics, ruled by the formidable Regina George, but when she does, the clique soon corrupts the new girl. Musical adaptation of the 2004 cult classic, starring Angourie Rice, Renee Rapp, Auli'i Cravalho, a

programme.title: Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire
programme.desc: Supernatural adventure starring Paul Rudd, featuring Bill Murray and Dan Aykroyd. The spook-hunting Spengler family joins forces with the original Ghostbusters, whose work is continuing via a secret research lab. When an ancient artefact is discovered and releases an evil force, the team must work together to prevent the dawning of a new Ice Age.

programme.title: Jackie Chan's The Tuxedo
programme.desc: Action comedy starring Jackie Chan and Jennifer Love Hewitt. New York City limo driver Jimmy Tong finds himself thrust into the world of international espionage when he dons a hi-tech tuxedo belonging to his secret-agent boss.

programme.title: Blue Beetle
programme.desc: An ancient relic of alien biotechnology known as the Scarab chooses college graduate Jaime Reyes as its symbiotic host. He is transformed into the superhero Blue Beetle, who is protected by a suit of armour. However, powerful businesswoman Victoria Kord will stop at nothing to acquire the Scarab. Fantasy adventure based on the DC Comics creation, starring Xolo MaridueÃ±a and Bruna Marquezine.

programme.desc: Biblical comedy starring LaKeith Stanfield. programme.desc: A Treasury agent (J.K. Simmons) closes in on a brilliant freelance accountant (Ben Affleck) who works for dangerous criminal organizations.

programme.title: End of Watch
programme.desc: Two LAPD officers deal with marriage, love and fatherhood amid the harsh realities on the streets of Los Angeles.

programme.title: Unknown
programme.desc: After a serious car accident, a man (Liam Neeson) awakes to find that his wife does not recognize him, that another man has assumed his identity, and that assassins are hunting him.

programme.title: Sully
programme.desc: After landing US Airways Flight 1549 in New York's Hudson River, Capt. Chesley "Sully" Sullenberger (Tom Hanks) faces an investigation that threatens to destroy his career and reputation.

programme.title: Greenland
programme.desc: A family embarks on a perilous journey as a planet-killing comet hurtles toward Earth. As the countdown to the global apocalypse approaches zero, their incredible trek culminates in a desperate and last-minute flight to a possible safe haven.

programme.title: Black Death
programme.desc: A monk investigates rumors of people being resurrected during an outbreak of the bubonic plague.

programme.title: The Conjuring: The Devil Made Me Do It
programme.desc: Paranormal investigators Ed and Lorraine Warren take on one of the most sensational cases of their careers when a young murder suspect claims demonic possession as his defense.

programme.title: It: Chapter Two
programme.desc: Defeated by members of the Losers' Club, the evil clown Pennywise returns 27 years later to terrorize the town of Derry, Maine. Now adults, the united Losers must conquer their deepest fears to destroy the shape-shifting Pennywise once and for all.

programme.title: My Golden Days
programme.desc: A middle-aged anthropologist (Mathieu Amalric) reminisces about family, school adventures, a student trip to the USSR and the love (Lou Roy-Lecollinet) of his life.

programme.title: Wonder Woman 1984
programme.desc: Wonder Woman musters all of her strength, wisdom and courage as she finds herself squaring off against Maxwell Lord and the Cheetah, a villainess who possesses superhuman strength and agility.

programme.title: Morbius
programme.desc: Dangerously ill with a rare blood disorder and determined to save others from the same fate, Dr. Morbius attempts a desperate gamble. While at first it seems to be a radical success, a darkness inside of him is soon unleashed.

programme.title: Krampus
programme.desc: Members (Emjay Anthony, Adam Scott, Toni Collette) of a dysfunctional family face the wrath of Krampus, an ancient demon from European folklore who punishes naughty children at Christmastime.

programme.title: Jupiter Ascending
programme.desc: A genetically engineered soldier (Channing Tatum) informs an ordinary woman (Mila Kunis) of her destiny as the next recipient of an extraordinary inheritance that could alter the balance of the cosmos.

programme.title: Chernobyl
programme.desc: Plant workers and firefighters put their lives on the line to control a catastrophic April 1986 explosion at a Soviet nuclear power plant.

programme.title: Chernobyl
programme.desc: With untold millions at risk, nuclear physicist Ulana Khomyuk makes a desperate attempt to reach Valery Legasov, a leading Soviet nuclear physicist, and warn him about the threat of a second explosion that could devastate the continent.

programme.title: Chernobyl
programme.desc: Lyudmilla Ignatenko, a Pripyat resident, ignores warnings about her firefighter husband's contamination; Valery Legasov lays out a decontamination plan, complete with human risks.

programme.title: Chernobyl
programme.desc: Valery Legasov and Soviet Deputy Prime Minister Boris Shcherbina consider using lunar rovers to remove radioactive debris; Ulana Khomyuk faces government hurdles in determining the truth about the cause of the explosion.

programme.title: It
programme.desc: Seven young outcasts are about to face their worst nightmare -- an ancient, shape-shifting evil that emerges every 27 years to prey on children. Banding together, the friends must overcome their personal fears to battle the murderous clown Pennywise.

programme.title: The Front Room
programme.desc: Everything goes to hell for newly pregnant Belinda after her mother-in-law moves in. As the diabolical guest tries to get her claws on the child, Belinda must draw the line somewhere.

programme.title: Suicide Squad
programme.desc: Deadshot (Will Smith), Harley Quinn (Margot Robbie), Captain Boomerang, Killer Croc and other armed supervillains unite to battle a mysterious and powerful entity, while the diabolical Joker (Jared Leto) launches an evil agenda of his own.

programme.title: Men in Black
programme.desc: A police officer joins a secret organization that polices and monitors extraterrestrial interactions on Earth.

programme.title: Men in Black II
programme.desc: Two interstellar agents try to stop an alien disguised as a lingerie model from destroying the world.

programme.title: Men in Black 3
programme.desc: Agent J goes back in time and joins forces with Agent K's younger self to save his partner, the agency and mankind's future.

programme.title: It Follows
programme.desc: Following a strange sexual encounter, a teenager (Maika Monroe) has disturbing visions and the inescapable feeling that someone -- or something -- is stalking her.

programme.title: Candyman: Farewell to the Flesh
programme.desc: The daughter (Kelly Rowan) of a New Orleans aristocrat ties his murder to the legend of an artist (Tony Todd) fitted with a hook.

programme.title: Amityville: Where the Echo Lives
programme.desc: A paranormal investigator must confront a terrorizing dark entity that is haunting a beloved neighbor's home.

programme.title: Krampus
programme.desc: Members (Emjay Anthony, Adam Scott, Toni Collette) of a dysfunctional family face the wrath of Krampus, an ancient demon from European folklore who punishes naughty children at Christmastime.

programme.title: Evil Dead Rise
programme.desc: A reunion between two estranged sisters gets cut short by the rise of flesh-possessing demons, thrusting them into a primal battle for survival as they face the most nightmarish version of family imaginable.

programme.title: Look Into My Eyes
programme.desc: A group of New York City psychics conducts deeply intimate readings for their clients, revealing a kaleidoscope of loneliness, connection and healing.

programme.title: Cirque du Freak: The Vampire's Assistant
programme.desc: After a sideshow vampire (John C. Reilly) turns a teenager into one of the undead, the kid becomes a pawn between warring supernatural factions.

programme.title: Central Intelligence
programme.desc: A lethal CIA agent (Dwayne Johnson) and his former classmate (Kevin Hart) encounter shootouts, espionage and double-crosses while trying to save the U.S. spy satellite system.

programme.title: The Perks of Being a Wallflower
programme.desc: Socially awkward Charlie is a wallflower watching from the sidelines, until a pair of charismatic seniors take him under their wing.

programme.title: Shazam!
programme.desc: Billy Batson is a streetwise 14-year-old who can magically transform into the adult superhero Shazam simply by shouting out one word. His newfound powers soon get put to the test when he squares off against the evil Dr. Thaddeus Sivana.

programme.title: Shazam! Fury of the Gods
programme.desc: When a vengeful trio of ancient gods arrives on Earth in search of the magic stolen from them long ago, Shazam and his allies get thrust into a battle for their superpowers, their lives, and the fate of the world.

programme.title: Valerian and the City of a Thousand Planets
programme.desc: In the 28th century, two special operatives (Dane DeHaan, Cara Delevingne) race against time to save the diverse city of Alpha from a dark force that also jeopardizes the future of the universe.

programme.title: A Different Man
programme.desc: Aspiring actor Edward undergoes a radical medical procedure to drastically transform his appearance. But his new dream face turns into a nightmare as he becomes obsessed with reclaiming what he lost.

programme.title: Civil War
programme.desc: In a fractured near-future America balanced on the razor's edge, a group of journalists must race through battlefields to reach the White House before D.C. falls.

programme.title: Trap
programme.desc: A man and his teenage daughter realize they're at the center of a dark and sinister event while watching a concert.

programme.title: The Stroll
programme.desc: The history of New York's Meatpacking District told from the perspective of transgender sex workers who lived and worked there. they recount the violence, policing, and gentrification that led to a movement for transgender rights.

programme.title: Jackie
programme.desc: The assassination of JFK is seen through the eyes of Jackie Kennedy. The days leading up to the tragedy and the immediate aftermath are chronicled, as experienced by the First Lady, wife of the charismatic president and mother of two small children.

programme.title: Barbie
programme.desc: Barbie and Ken are having the time of their lives in the colorful and seemingly perfect world of Barbie Land. However, when they get a chance to go to the real world, they soon discover the joys and perils of living among humans.

programme.title: The Watchers
programme.desc: A 28-year-old artist gets stranded in an expansive, untouched forest in western Ireland. Finding shelter, she unknowingly becomes trapped alongside three strangers who are stalked by mysterious creatures every night.

programme.title: Good Hair
programme.desc: Comic Chris Rock explores how hairstyles affect the self-esteem, activities and relationships of African-Americans.

programme.title: Severance
programme.desc: A killer stalks members (Danny Dyer, Laura Harris, Tim McInnerny) of a sales group from an international arms company, who have become lost in the woods during a team-building weekend.

programme.title: Another Country
programme.desc: An interracial couple try to raise their child during the racially polarizing times of 1956 Mississippi.

programme.title: Fast & Furious
programme.desc: Brian O'Conner, back working for the FBI in Los Angeles, teams up with Dominic Toretto to bring down a heroin importer by infiltrating his operation.

programme.title: The Synanon Fix: Did the Cure Become a Cult?
programme.desc: Recovering alcoholic Charles Dederich opens a drug rehabilitation program; Synanon, as he names it, soon attracts celebrities and non-addicts who donate their time and wealth; the community grows into a movement that expands across the country.

programme.title: The Synanon Fix: Did the Cure Become a Cult?
programme.desc: Chuck establishes "The Synanon Religion" and maintains their tax-exempt status; Chuck becomes increasingly authoritative and dictatorial; many members find themselves weighing the benefits and costs of the choices they're forced to make.

programme.title: The Synanon Fix: Did the Cure Become a Cult?
programme.desc: Chuck's behavior becomes more belligerent and abusive; he forms a military-like boot camp for delinquent children where corporal punishment abounds; TIME Magazine publishes "Swinging at Synanon" and Chuck sues for $76 million as his paranoia grows.

programme.title: The Synanon Fix: Did the Cure Become a Cult?
programme.desc: In 1977, the Los Angeles Times reports on the nine-day abduction of Frances Winn by Synanon; Chuck spends $62,000 on guns and ammunition; sentenced to five years probation, Chuck loses everything and dies in a nursing home.

programme.title: Camp Hell
programme.desc: Horrific events plague a teen when his parents send him to a Christian camp.

programme.title: The Birth of a Nation
programme.desc: On Aug. 21, 1831, Baptist preacher Nat Turner (Nate Parker) leads a violent and historic rebellion to free himself and other slaves in Southampton County, Va.

programme.desc: Residents and thousands of vacationers grapple with rising numbers of great white sharks off the coast of Cape Cod, Mass. Scientists investigate what has caused the surge, and what it can reveal about ocean health.

programme.desc: A retired assassin is drawn back into his former life and a confrontation with an old rival when his daughter is kidnapped.

programme.desc: Jaime Reyes finds himself in possession of an ancient relic of alien biotechnology called the Scarab. When the Scarab chooses Jaime to be its symbiotic host, he's bestowed with a suit of armor that's capable of extraordinary and unpredictable powers.
